botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Toxic if eaten, wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Delphinium can be annuals, biennials or perennials, with palmately lobed basal leaves and showy bowl-shaped flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a fertile, well-drained but moisture-retentive soil in full sun, in a position sheltered from strong winds, and provide stakes or other supports (for more advice on support, see staking perennials) See also delphinium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by basal softwood cuttings in spring, or by division in early spring or early autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: No pruning required except deadheading, cutting spent flower spikes back to flowering sideshoots, and cutting all growth down to ground level at the end of the growing season
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, earwigs, delphinium leaf miner, delphinium moth caterpillars, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, delphinium black blotch, grey moulds, sclerotinia disease, crown rot and cucumber mosaic virus
